value:
Bord, Cord, and Barst are all experts
of fighting on the shores and waters.
They are true men of the sea.

When I was a gladiator, I was made to
fight for spectacle. I didn't know what
the next day would bring...$k$pPrincess Caeda changed my fortunes.

Princess Caeda kindly told me that I
can enjoy the beach, but... I have no
idea how to spend my time here.

The beaches of Talys were beautiful,
but Askr's beaches are also
captivating.

Even at the beach, I still need to take
care of my weapons. I don't want the
salty air to rust them.

I bring summer greetings from
$Nf.$k$pWe're on vacation, so excuse my
appearance.

Hm. Guess I've improved after
some time in the summer sun.

No matter what I'm wearing, I'll
always work to meet my employer's
expectations.
It's not like me to let my guard down.

Thanks. This gift from the beach will
give me strength.

My name is Ogma. I won't allow
anyone to disturb Princess
Caeda's holiday.

In truth, I once had no good
memories of the beach.$k$pIn my days as a mercenary, there
were many battles fought on the
beach and many lives lost to the sea.$k$pHowever, a beach without fighting is
a beautiful place to be. I finally feel
that I understand its magnificence.$k$pI am very grateful that both you and
Princess Caeda invited me to come.$k$pWhen our holiday is over, the fight in
Askr will resume. With my renewed
strength, I will give all I have to Askr.
でやっ
Disappear
ぐっ…
You...!
An easy win.
No match for me.
I'll beat you at swimming, too.
I'll put you under.
Sun...stroke...
exhale from the heat (Phew)
I'm Ogma. My orders are to enjoy 'summer activities.' I...don't know what that means.
What is it? I hope you're not bored.
Mercenary work took me all over the continent. ...I've never seen a place this beautiful.
I don't know what to do with myself here. Do I get in the water or...?
I can master any weapon, even this one. You'll see.
I shouldn't be at the beach with Princess Caeda like this. It's not my place.
It's been good to unwind like this.
Got it.
Hmm...
The waves are high.
